subject: Photography
title: The Last Days of Film Dominance
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Last Days of Film Dominance.

hook.text: In 2000, Kodak sold billions in film. By 2012, they filed for bankruptcy. Digital photography killed an empire.

buildup.text: Film dominated photography for over 150 years. Labs, darkrooms, and chemical processes defined the craft.

discovery.text: Early digital cameras were expensive and low-quality. But they offered instant review â€” no waiting for developing.

twist.text: Kodak actually invented the first digital camera in 1975 but shelved it to protect their film profits.

climax.text: The transition took just one decade. By 2010, film was niche. An entire industry reinvented itself.

punchline.text: Kodak built the future, then refused to live in it.

quiz.question: What company invented the first digital camera but shelved it?
options: Kodak, to protect their film business
Canon, because it was too expensive
Nikon, because it was too heavy
